text: Delma is a luxury watch company based in Lengnau, Switzerland, founded by the brothers Adolf and Albert Gilomen in 1924. == History == The Gilomen brothers originally registered four brands: Thuya, Midland, Delma and Gil. Thuya served as the company’s name, and the other brands were used for watch models. The Delma brand name first appeared on watches in 1933. It was established as the company’s name in 1966 with the company take over by Ulrich Wüthrich and Fritz Fankhauser. In 1996 Ulrich Wüthrich's son-in-law, Fred Leibundgut, entered the company and took over as President and CEO. == Collections == * Delma watches are divided into five subsections: Racing, Diver, Dress and Ladies. * Delma released its first professional diver's watch in 1975. * Delma released a professional diver's watch with a water-resistance to 3,000 metres (9,900 ft) in 2011. == Marketing == In 2016, Delma entered a partnership with the IMOCA 60 as Official Timer of the Transat New York to Vendée. == References == == Other websites == * Category:Companies of Switzerland Category:1920s establishments in Switzerland Category:1924 establishments in Europe Category:Biel/Bienne (administrative district)
title: Delma
